attributes.action: Force TFL to run a full tube service during the Coronavirus pandemic
attributes.additional_details: Transport for London (TFL) have massively reduced the number of tubes running during the coronavirus pandemic causing overcrowding on their networks despite the fact that there are a lot fewer commuters. This is putting our essential workers including NHS Doctors and Nurses at a much higher risk of infection. This is likely to be one of the biggest contributors to the spread of Covid-19 in the UK at the present time and therefore it is paramount that it is resolved as soon as possible.
attributes.background: Force Transport for London (TFL) to run a full tube service throughout the coronavirus pandemic by enabling their lowest risk self-isolating workers to return to work with the necessary PPE and social distancing in place. If this is not possible the government must ensure more staff are brought in.

rejection.details:
The Government is not responsible for tube services, which are managed by Transport for London.

You can petition the London Assembly directly about matters Transport for London is responsible for.
https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here: 

www.gov.uk/coronavirus 

https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/ 

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support 

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips
